intro: Thunbergia napperae, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, reaching lengths of up to several meters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
